  physical_appearance: This is a pair of portrait photographs of Peter Lim Ah Pin and Florence Yeo. On the left
 the portrait depicts a man in a cream-coloured shirt
 with a mandarin collar. His hair is clipped back
 and his head is slightly tilted to the left. On the right
 the portrait depicts a woman wearing a kebaya adorned wit diamond brooch. Her hair is pulled back and secured with a pin.

  subject_terms_1: Folk costume families (kinship groups) Peranakan Roman Catholicism companion portraits

  subject_terms_2: Photographs Ethnic costume Family History Peranakan (Asian people) Catholics

  subject_terms_3: Portrait photography Family history

  sgcool_label_text: The portrait of Peter Lim Ah Pin depicts a man in a cream-coloured shirt with a simple mandarin collar. The other portrait shows Florence Yeo in a floral kebaya with a set of diamond kerosang made in the Melaka style. Both portraits are coloured photographs
 bear the signature of the same artist and were probably made as a pair. Peter Lim owned a successful bee hoon manufacturing business and was known as the ‘Bee Hoon King’. He also built several markets
 schools and houses. Lim Ah Pin Road and Florence Road were named after the couple
 who owned and rented out several properties in the area.

metadata.title_text: Pair of portraits (Peter Lim Ah Pin and Florence Yeo) Peter Lim Ah Pin and Florence Yeo
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a pair of portrait photographs of Peter Lim Ah Pin and Florence Yeo. On the left, the portrait depicts a man in a cream-coloured shirt, with a mandarin collar. His hair is clipped back, and his head is slightly tilted to the left. On the right, the portrait depicts a woman wearing a kebaya adorned wit diamond brooch. Her hair is pulled back and secured with a pin.
metadata.subject_terms_1: Folk costume families (kinship groups) Peranakan Roman Catholicism companion portraits
metadata.subject_terms_2: Photographs Ethnic costume Family History Peranakan (Asian people) Catholics
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The portrait of Peter Lim Ah Pin depicts a man in a cream-coloured shirt with a simple mandarin collar. The other portrait shows Florence Yeo in a floral kebaya with a set of diamond kerosang made in the Melaka style. Both portraits are coloured photographs, bear the signature of the same artist and were probably made as a pair. Peter Lim owned a successful bee hoon manufacturing business and was known as the ‘Bee Hoon King’. He also built several markets, schools and houses. Lim Ah Pin Road and Florence Road were named after the couple, who owned and rented out several properties in the area.
